message.content:
<<<api>>>: RadioGroup.setOnCheckedChangeListener
<<<code>>>: RadioGroup radioGroup = (RadioGroup) findViewById(R.id.radioSex);
        radioGroup.setOnCheckedChangeListener(new RadioGroup.OnCheckedChangeListener() {
            @Override
            public void onCheckedChanged(RadioGroup group, int checkedId) {
                // Handle radio button selection here
                if (checkedId == R.id.radioMale) {
                    // Show list of radio buttons for male
                } else if (checkedId == R.id.radioFemale) {
                    // Show list of radio buttons for female
                }
            }
        });
<<<explanation>>>: Use the RadioGroup.setOnCheckedChangeListener to listen for changes in the selected radio button. Inside the onCheckedChanged method, you can handle the selection of each radio button and show the corresponding list of radio buttons.
